Christopher Nolan’s upcoming epic The Odyssey will make history as the first commercial feature film shot entirely on Imax film cameras. 🎥🎬

While Nolan has long championed the format—using it for large portions of films like Dunkirk, Tenet, and Oppenheimer—this marks the first time a movie will be filmed entirely in Imax, on 70mm film, from beginning to end.

Following the success of Oppenheimer, which earned over $190 million on Imax screens alone, Nolan challenged Imax to improve its technology. The result: new Imax film cameras that are 30% quieter, significantly lighter, and backed by faster scanning and processing for quicker access to dailies. “If you can solve the problems, I’ll shoot the whole thing in Imax,” Nolan told Imax CEO Rich Gelfond. Now that promise is coming to life.

The new camera system is currently reserved for The Odyssey, but Imax plans to make the gear available to other directors after Nolan finishes the film. Interest is already surging, with a record number of films in 2025 either using Imax cameras or filming specifically for the format—including Sinners, Mission: Impossible – The Final Reckoning, and Formula One starring Brad Pitt.
